description.narrative:
As part of GRAISEA 2.0, the GRAISEA 2.0 in Vietnam aims to promote sustainable and inclusive value chain governance for shrimp and rice sector that emphasizes women#s economic empowerment and climate resilience as two key issues impacting to the sustainability and equalities of agribusiness in Vietnam. The overall objective is: #Lives of small-scale producers and laborers in Vietnam agribusiness are transformed through enhanced women#s economic empowerment in climate resilient and sustainable shrimp/ricevalue chains development#. GRAISEA 2.0 in Vietnam builds and strengthens initial achievements and lesson-learnt of GRAISEA 1.0 with more effective andinnovative collaboration mechanism that help SSPs, especially women, gain fairer benefits and shared risks in the value chains, so that they are capable to respond, adapt and mitigate relevant risks including market shock, financial risks, and climate change. Thus, Vietnam program therefore proposes to achieve the following results:
RESULT 1: Small-scale producers (SSPs), especially women, gain fairer opportunities and benefits in climate resilient, sustainable, and inclusive value chains of shrimp/rice RESULT 2: Companies in shrimp and rice sectors enhanced business effectiveness through adopting andpracticing responsible business and sustainable and inclusive value chain governance conducts with focuses on women#s economic empowerment and climate resilience RESULT 3: Vietnam government (at national and provincial levels) incentivize responsible business practice and sustainable and inclusive value chain governance that enhance women#s economic empowerment and climate resilience

participating-org.narrative: In Vietnam , Oxfam is one of the leading international, non -governmental organisation. Since 1955, Oxfam is active in Vietnam withhumanitarian interventions and started development work in the late 1980's. Today, Oxfam works in 26 provinces with people, governments and civil society to promote equality and well-being through social and economic change.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
